tagPrefix.description: The prefix used for Git tags, usually the project name

preset.description: The commit message convention preset used by commitizen

baseBranch.description: The Git branch that should be used as the base for versioning

synced.description: Whether or not the local Git repository is synced with the remote repository

packages.description: The directories in the repository that contain packages

updateInternalDependencies.description: How to update internal dependencies between packages

strategy.description: The strategy used for determining the release version

conventionalChangelogConfiguration.title: Conventional Changelog Configuration
conventionalChangelogConfiguration.description: Describes the configuration options supported by conventional-config for upstream tooling.

name.description: A base preset name to be customized.

header.description: A string to be used as the main header section of the CHANGELOG.

types.description: An array of `type` objects representing the explicitly supported commit message types, and whether they should show up in generated `CHANGELOG`s.

preMajor.description:
Boolean indicating whether or not the action being run (generating CHANGELOG, recommendedBump, etc.) is being performed for a pre-major release (<1.0.0).
 This config setting will generally be set by tooling and not a user.

commitUrlFormat.description: A URL representing a specific commit at a hash.

compareUrlFormat.description: A URL representing the comparison between two git SHAs.

issueUrlFormat.description: A URL representing the issue format (allowing a different URL format to be swapped in for Gitlab, Bitbucket, etc).

userUrlFormat.description: A URL representing the a user's profile URL on GitHub, Gitlab, etc. This URL is used for substituting @bcoe with https://github.com/bcoe in commit messages.

releaseCommitMessageFormat.description: A string to be used to format the auto-generated release commit message.

issuePrefixes.description: An array of prefixes used to detect references to issues

type.description: An object that describes a commit type's settings in the CHANGELOG
A string used to match <type>s used in the Conventional Commits convention.

scope.description: A string used to match `[optional scope]` used in the Conventional Commits convention.

section.description: The section where the matched commit type will display in the CHANGELOG.

hidden.description: Set to `true` to hide matched commit types in the CHANGELOG.
